contraindications.note: HIGH RISK OF C. DIFFICILE COLITIS. Use with caution in elderly and those with GI disease.

pcn_allergy.note: Excellent alternative for PCN allergy (no cross-reactivity). Covers oral anaerobes and MSSA.

severe_pcn_allergy.note: Safe with severe PCN allergy. First-line alternative for dental/oral infections.

pregnancy_notes: Safe in all trimesters. Commonly used for dental/SSTI in pregnancy with PCN allergy.

renal_adjustment.note: NO renal dose adjustment needed. Primarily hepatic metabolism.

dental.note: First-line for dental abscess with PCN allergy. Excellent oral anaerobe coverage.

head_neck.note: For peritonsillar abscess, Ludwig angina with PCN allergy

ssti_mrsa.note: Good for MRSA SSTI (not as good as TMP/SMX or doxycycline for CA-MRSA)

aspiration_pneumonia.note: Excellent anaerobe coverage for aspiration pneumonia

toxic_shock_syndrome.note: Added to vancomycin for toxin suppression (inhibits protein synthesis)

necrotizing_fasciitis.note: Added for toxin suppression (Group A Strep, Clostridium)

bite_wound.note: Alternative for bite wounds with PCN allergy (combine with ciprofloxacin for Pasteurella)

brain_abscess.note: Excellent CNS penetration and anaerobe coverage

pelvic_inflammatory_disease.duration: Until 24h afebrile, then switch to PO
pelvic_inflammatory_disease.note: Combined with gentamicin for polymicrobial coverage

ssti.note: Good for MRSA SSTI (not as good as TMP/SMX or doxycycline for CA-MRSA)

pediatric.note: PO: 10-30 mg/kg/day divided q6-8h. IV: 25-40 mg/kg/day divided q6-8h

spectrum.gram_positive: Excellent (Streptococcus, MSSA, some MRSA - check local susceptibility)

notes: ⚠️ HIGH RISK OF C. DIFFICILE COLITIS (10-20%)
First-line alternative for dental infections with PCN allergy
Good for MSSA, variable MRSA coverage (check local susceptibility)
Added to β-lactams for toxin suppression (necrotizing fasciitis, toxic shock)
Take with full glass of water to prevent esophagitis
WARN PATIENTS: Report diarrhea immediately (C. diff risk)
